description:
codes used for designating hazard statements with respect to physical, health and environmental hazards emanating from the substance according to the type of risk involved.
1 The hazard class of a substance cannot be derived from its UN number and needs to be looked up in UNECE Regulations on the transport of dangerous goods|
2 Hazard class codes are associated with pictogramms for marking package of goods during transport and storage.
UN Recommendations on the Transport of Dangerous Goods, Part 2 defines the hazard classes and their subdivisions; Part 3 contains a complete list of all UN numbers and their hazard class codes

See also UNECE Globally Harmonized System of Classification and Labelling of Chemicals 
GHS Rev.5, 2013.
